title: Aidan the Wonder Kid: A Food Allergy and Intolerance Story
features: He was a super hero with a furry sidekick. She was a secret mad scientist in the kitchen.But he was sick... and she was stumped. Can they work together to find out what is stealing his superpowers, and restore his boundless energy once again? Meet Aidan the Wonder Kid and his Super Smart Detective Mom. When food allergies strike, they bond together to fight back. But can they win? Kids will cheer for Aidan, and parents and teachers everywhere will love the message (and option to get free lesson plans!). Two kids in every classroom have a food allergy, and this book brings fun to the challenge of feeding every body just right. Get Aidan the Wonder Kid today, be cause we all have a little super hero in us.
description: When my son was first diagnosed with special dietary needs, it was a relief. We finally had answers for his health issues. What I didn't realize at first was that, besides attending to his nutritional needs, I would also be guiding him through the acceptance of his diagnosis, and navigating having to eat differently than all his friends. I would also be teaching everyone around him to keep him safe and healthy too.I quickly realized this emotional support piece, and educating his peers and community, was just as important as what I was feeding him. And so,

was born! My sincere hope is that parents and teachers alike can use this book as a tool to teach kids that we all have our best super powers when we feed our bodies just right, and sometimes that's a little different than our friends, and that's okay!

Colleen grew up in the rolling green hills of Vermont, where she spent much of her time devouring books. That love of reading eventually led to a teaching degree, with a Masters in Literacy. Later in her career, she became a Certified Health coach, and began her work supporting families and educators, and freelance writing in the health arena. That combining of passions led to this book. Today she spends her time with her husband, chasing their two kids, and dreaming up her next publication.

"If you have a child with food allergies, you know how difficult it can for both you and your kids to navigate through daily life, much less special events. Colleen has created Aidan, a sweet and relatable character who learns that he can feel "super," just by eating the right foods. All adults and children, battling food allergies or not, will appreciate Colleen's clever take on eating well to feel well" (Gluten Free CT)
